meanings.sent1: He falsed his age to get into the movie.
meanings.sent2: She falsed her address on the form.
meanings.sent3: The magician falsed the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: The news report falsed the reality of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The witness falsed his testimony under pressure.

meanings.sent1: The con artist falsed his identity to steal money.
meanings.sent2: She falsed her intentions to avoid trouble.
meanings.sent3: The prankster falsed his friend into believing a funny story.
meanings.sent4: The mirage falsed the travelers into thinking they saw an oasis.
meanings.sent5: The scammer falsed the email to trick people into giving personal information.

meanings.sent1: The falsed painting was quickly identified as a forgery.
meanings.sent2: Her falsed smile didn't fool anyone.
meanings.sent3: The falsed designer bag looked real from afar.
meanings.sent4: His falsed promises left a trail of disappointment.
meanings.sent5: The falsed documents were rejected by the authorities.
